message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.ST

The paper deals with the theoretical analysis of the Thompson Sampling algorithm for stochastic bandits, which is a popular algorithm in the field of machine learning and decision making. The paper uses martingale theory and focuses on worst-case dependence of regret on the choice of prior. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.IT (Information Theory), and cs.ST (Statistics).
